title: More evidence childhood vaccinations are dropping amid pandemic
description: The number of childhood vaccines administered in Michigan has dropped by as much as 22% amid the coronavirus pandemic, according to a report released Monday by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

title: See Dr. Gupta's reaction to Trump's Covid-19 revelation
description: President Donald Trump claimed he is taking daily doses of hydroxychloroquine, a drug he's long touted as a potential coronavirus cure even as medical experts question its efficacy and warn of potentially harmful side effects. CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta explains why Trump should not be taking the drug.

title: See dogs being trained to 'sniff out' Covid-19
description: Dogs are now being trained to detect people infected with coronavirus. CNN's Max Foster reports.

title: Hospital bed designed for coronavirus transforms into coffin
description: To combat shortages due to the coronavirus pandemic, the company ABC Displays has designed a cardboard hospital bed that can transform into a coffin. CNN's Stefano Pozzebon reports.

title: 'Treated as cargo:' Stranded cruise ship crews recount desperation
description: Stuck at sea, with home and family far away, the cruise ship crew members who have yet to be repatriated in the wake of the Covid-19 pandemic are struggling with being stranded — and it's taking a heavy toll.

title: Questioning the reliability of this coronavirus statistics site
description: Worldometer is a coronavirus statistics site that has been cited by governments, academics and news outlets. However, almost nothing is actually known about how it operates, where it's based and who is really behind it. CNN's Scott McLean investigates.

title: Ryan Seacrest didn't have a stroke during 'American Idol' finale, rep says
description: Ryan Seacrest wants fans to know he's OK.

title: Hurricanes, typhoons and cyclones are becoming stronger, according to a new NOAA study
description: It is becoming increasingly evident that hurricanes, typhoons, and tropical cyclones worldwide are becoming stronger and potentially more deadly as the globe warms due to the climate crisis, according to a new study.

title: This year's first Atlantic storm Arthur will bring high surf, strong winds and heavy rains to the North Carolina coast
description: Tropical Storm Arthur, the first named storm in the Atlantic for 2020, will bring high surf, heavy rains and strong winds to the coast of North Carolina.

title: Congress just did something it hasn't done in a decade
description: Congress is like the dentist. You know it's there and that you occasionally have to deal with it. But that doesn't make it pleasant.

title: Trump looks to advance unfounded Obama crime conspiracy
description: President Donald Trump headed into the weekend appearing convinced his predecessor committed a crime worthy of investigation -- despite being unable to name the crime or provide any evidence for it. By Sunday, he emerged prepared to wage wholesale political war with the last person who held his office.

title: Death toll nears 90,000
Age-proof your brain by keeping your heart healthy, study says
description: Managing your heart disease risk factors may help you avoid Alzheimer's and other dementias later in life, a study finds.

title: Germany and France try to break deadlock over how to rescue the EU
description: Germany and France unveiled an initiative Monday aimed at rescuing the European Union from the toughest crisis in its history and bridging the deep national divisions that have stalled progress on a pandemic recovery fund.

title: Gold nears an eight-year high
description: Gold prices have soared this year, and some experts think they could eventually pass the all-time high north of $1,900 an ounce.

title: Democrats tell Supreme Court they need Mueller grand jury docs to decide on new impeachment articles
description: The Democratic-led House of Representatives on Monday told the Supreme Court that the House needs secret Mueller grand jury materials to determine if there is new evidence of impeachable offenses involving President Donald Trump.

title: How Trump wins again, in 3 sentences
Barr doesn't expect review of Russia probe will 'lead to a criminal investigation' of Obama and Biden
description: Attorney General William Barr on Monday said Barack Obama and Joe Biden are unlikely to be under criminal investigation in a review of the Russia probe that began in 2016 -- addressing simmering accusations by President Donald Trump against his predecessor and his 2020 opponent.

title: Meryl Streep and Chris Hemsworth among stars to join Taika Waititi for Roald Dahl charity reading
description: Academy award-winning filmmaker Taika Waititi has enlisted some celebrity friends to help him retell a very special story.

title: Soccer team apologizes for allegedly filling stands with sex dolls
description: South Korean football team FC Seoul has apologized after fans accused the club of using sex dolls to fill empty stands at its second game of the K League season.

title: Videos show multiple people trespassed at home Ahmaud Arbery visited. He was the only one killed
description: Ahmaud Arbery was shot and killed while jogging in Brunswick, Georgia, on February 23, 2020.

title: How Trump wins again, in 3 sentences
description:
• ANALYSIS: Trump officials have new scapegoats for death toll
• Health experts slam Trump administration's use of public health law to close border

title: Early results from vaccine trial show participants developed antibodies against the virus
description: • MARKETS LIVE: Dow soars on vaccine hope

title: Apple rolls out temperature checks and mask requirements as stores reopen
description: Shopping at Apple stores will be a drastically different experience when the company reopens the more than 500 global locations it closed in response to the coronavirus pandemic.

title: China backs WHO coronavirus investigation on one condition
Some mud flows like lava on Mars, study says
description: The surface of Mars is covered in intriguing features that suggest hints about the planet's past and the water that once existed on its surface.

title: China backs coronavirus investigation on one condition
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping said he supports calls for an investigation into the handling of the coronavirus pandemic at a key summit Monday, but insisted that any inquiry should wait until the virus is contained.

title: As hospitals in Brazil teeter on the brink of collapse, Bolsonaro does pushups with supporters
description: The health care system in Brazil's largest city is wavering on the brink of collapse and coronavirus deaths throughout the South American nation are soaring -- but President Jair Bolsonaro nonetheless reveled in crowds of supporters on Sunday, joining yet another anti-lockdown protest in Brasilia.

title: Another coronavirus record-breaker: World's shortest airline routes
description: The coronavirus pandemic has been the most financially disastrous force in the century-old history of commercial air travel.

title: Kim Kardashian launches face masks as part of Skims line
description: Kim Kardashian West has joined the fight against the coronavirus pandemic by launching a range of face masks.

title: Early results from coronavirus vaccine trial show promise
Hong Kong lawmakers scuffle as pro-Beijing politicians clear path for controversial bill
description: There were scuffles in Hong Kong's parliament Monday as lawmakers fought for control of a key committee chair.

title: CEO of Europe's largest airline calls UK quarantine plans 'idiotic'
Husband of missing Colorado woman says he'll do 'whatever it takes' to bring wife back
description: As the search continues for Suzanne Morphew, a Colorado woman who vanished on Mother's Day, her husband posted an emotional plea on Facebook saying he would do "whatever it takes" to get her back.

title: Premier League clubs vote in favor of returning to training as 'Project Restart' edges closer
description: The Premier League has edged closer to restarting as its clubs voted in favor of resuming training, while adhering to strict medical protocols outlined by the organization's 'Project Restart' plan.

title: Hannah Brown, 'Bachelorette' star, apologizes for using the N-word
description: It was a rap song which got Hannah Brown in hot water.

title: CEO of Europe's largest airline calls UK quarantine plans 'idiotic'
description: The CEO of Europe's largest airline has slammed the UK government's handling of the coronavirus pandemic and described plans to impose a 14-day quarantine on international visitors as "idiotic and unimplementable."

title: Super cyclone heads toward India and Bangladesh
description: A powerful cyclone that formed in the Bay of Bengal is headed directly for the India-Bangladesh border, bringing with it the potential for major destruction and upheaval in two countries that are still battling the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Dwayne Johnson says his mind is blown by daughter Simone following him into WWE
description: Dwayne Johnson says he is "very proud" that his 18-year-old daughter is following in his footsteps by entering the world of professional wrestling.

title: Two Pakistani women murdered in so-called honor killing after a leaked video circulates online
description: Two women in Pakistan have been murdered in a so-called "honor killing" after a video showing them kissing a man circulated online.

title: Trip of a lifetime with no end in sight: Life on the small boats stuck at sea
description: While 38-year-olds Leslie and Andrew Godfrey enjoyed a five-day, 750-mile sailing passage from Sri Lanka to the Maldives, the whole world changed.

title: Myanmar police make Asia's biggest drug bust in decades, seizing 200 million meth tablets
description: Myanmar police have made Asia's biggest drug bust in decades, seizing hundreds of millions of dollars worth of contraband including "unprecedented" amounts of methylfentanyl, a chemical used to make a dangerously potent synthetic opioid.

title: Man interviewed over rail worker's coronavirus death after alleged spitting incident
description: Police have interviewed a man in connection with an incident in which a rail worker died from coronavirus after allegedly being spat on at a London train station.

title: International Museum Day: Which museums around the world have reopened?
description: Since its founding in 1977, International Museum Day has been held every May 18 to celebrate museums as valuable spaces for cultural exchange.

title: Parents 'devastated' as their babies are stranded during pandemic
description: Born amidst the Covid-19 pandemic, many surrogate babies in Ukraine have been left stranded by the lockdown and travel restrictions. CNN shows the inside of a facility in Kiev where more than 50 babies can't be collected by their legal parents. CNN's Matthew Chance reports.

title: University gives therapy dog an honorary degree
description: Moose, an 8-year-old therapy dog at Virginia Tech who has helped thousands of students cope with mental health issues, has received an honorary doctorate in veterinary medicine.

title: Five tips to look more professional on a video conference
description: With more people working from home, video conferencing has become the new norm.  These five tips will help make you look more professional on your video conference.
